Name: Scroll depth
description: Depth of scroll by quartiles and 90%
Note: For scrolls on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Exit link
description: clicks on links to exit the site, including where an interstitial is involved
Note: {click|continue} applicable where an interstitial is involved, where no interstitial, please use $link_text. For outbound_links on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Form validation error
description: This event will fire if for some reason the form couldn't be submitted.

Name: Form submission
description: This event will fire after the user clicks to submit the form successfully.. This should not fire if the form submission is unsuccessful

Name: Form field completion
description: Only populate the event with $FieldValue when the user clicks to select an option (e.g. Dropdown menu, checkboxes, radio buttons…). This should never be used to pull open field information (e.g. First Name, Last Name, Address, Phone, Gender, any PII…) or user's Age/Date of birth, even if it's a Dropdown menu or checkbox.  For open fields, a completion is when a user has typed in at least a character into a field and has then clicked outside that field.  For drop down menu items, a completion is when a user has selected an item from the menu.  For radio buttons and checkboxes, a completion is when a user has checked an item and has then clicked anywhere outside of them.  This event will fire every time that the user completes a field.
Note: Where $FieldValue should be added when the user clicks to select an option (e.g. Dropdown menu, checkboxes, radio buttons…).

Name: Form submission details
description: This event will fire after the user clicks to submit the form, right after the "form_submissions" event. And it will contain all the fields that were filled for those that have successfully submitted the form. It'll be one event for each Field Completion.  Only populate the event with $FieldValue when the user clicks to select an option (e.g., Dropdown menu, checkboxes, radio buttons…). This should never be used to pull open field information (e.g., First Name, Last Name, Address, Gender, Phone, any PII…) or user's Age/Date of birth, even if it's a Dropdown menu or checkbox.
Note: Where $FieldValue should be added when the user clicks to select an option (e.g. Dropdown menu, checkboxes, radio buttons…). Dev to flag if this is not possible to track

Name: Header links
description: clicks on header links

Name: Footer links
description: clicks on footer links

Name: Navigation
description: Track navigation from the nav bar

Name: Shares
description: Any share (social, email, etc.)
Note: Not possible to track share completion as the act of sharing takes the user to a third party. For shares on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Video interval seconds
description: Video progression by 10s intervals for the length of the video
Note: For video interactions on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Video plays
description: Video Starts/Ends
Note: For video interactions on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Video interval percent
description: Video progression by quartiles
Note: For video interactions on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: CTA
description: cta_clicks
Note: Where $CTAText is the text of the CTA button and $CTA URL is the click url of the CTA button. For click elements on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: ISI click
description: interactions with expandable ISI
Note: For isi interactions on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Expansions
description: Expandable content interactions

Name: Click to call
description: click to call - on any device

Name: Error page load
description: Redundant (but elevated) instance of page_view event that is triggered by error pages (404) specifically
Note: 403 and 500 have server-side errors and would not allow GTM to load, therefore, rendering them untrackable.

Name: Anchor link
description: Clicks on the anchor links for long scrolling sites

Name: Interstitial load
description: Whenever an interstital is launched

Name: Interstitial dismiss
description: Whenever an interstital is Dismissed

Name: Tabs
description: Track interaction with tabbed content
Note: $Title here should capture Pageload or Click for tabs.  e.g. The tabs in the 'Support & Resources" page "My neffyconnect", "Videos", "Tools & Resources", and "Community Support". For click elements on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Back to top
description: clicks on the back to top button (^) on any pages of the site
Note: For back to top click on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Click action
description: Covers all click events on site including clicks to download, CTAs, etc. Excludes outbound links.
Note: $ContentTitle Represents the title of the content block (e.g., grid tile, card, or similar component) where the interaction occurs.  This value is captured when a user clicks a button located within or beneath the content block.  Example: On the homepage, within the "Test Your Knowledge" grid, when a user clicks any of the buttons labeled "64%", "83%", or "12%", the value of cd_event_label should capture $ContentTitle, which in this case is: "Test Your Knowledge". For click elements on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Slideshow interaction
description: clicks on pause/ resume button for a slideshow

Name: Click to email
description: click to email - on any device
Note: e.g. Send us an email at: communityprograms@ars-pharma.com on the neffy-in-schools page

Name: Next page
description: clicks on the 'Next Page' navigation links at the body of the page, directing to the next page
Note: For click elements on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Navigation expand
description: expandable element on the navigation bar (either mouse hovering on desktop website or clicked to expand the dropdown on mobile site)

Name: File download
description: when a user clicks a link leading to a file (with a common file extension) of the following types:document text executable presentation compressed file video audio File extensions that match the following regex will trigger the event: pdf|xlsx?|docx?|txt|rtf|csv|exe|key|pp(s|t|tx)| 7z|pkg|rar|gz|zip|avi|mov|mp4|mpe?g|wmv|midi?|mp3|wav|wma
Note: For file downloads on any tabbed sections, fire $PagePath_$TabName

Name: Home page
description: click to neffy logo (directed to homepage) on any pages
